hours_text:
**HOURS:**

Wednesday – Sunday  
11 am – 5 pm

**We are currently closed through** **February 7, 2026. Regular public hours resume February 8, 2026.**

**The Museum will be closed April 1–5 for spring break.**

**ADMISSION:**

$5 Suggested donation.

**LOCATION:**

The Dorsky is located on the SUNY New Paltz campus close to the main entrance on Route 32 S./South Manheim Boulevard. When you enter campus look for the glass pyramid structure, the Student Union Building. The Museum can be seen beyond that building. Approach the Museum via the plaza between the glass pyramid and the tall Haggerty Administration Building.  
  
[Google Maps](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Samuel+Dorsky+Museum+of+Art/@41.7409916,-74.0857322,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89dd227ac44b77b5:0xf80c8468be43f93d!8m2!3d41.7409876!4d-74.0835435)

Mailing Address:  
State University of New York at New Paltz  
1 Hawk Drive  _  
_New Paltz, NY 12561  
845.257.3844

[Additional Directions](https://www.newpaltz.edu/about/directions.html)

**PARKING:**

**Free Parking:** Two [museum-designated parking spaces](https://www.google.com/maps/place/41%C2%B044'26.2%22N+74%C2%B004'52.7%22W/@41.740597,-74.0819601,19z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m4!3m3!8m2!3d41.740596!4d-74.081315?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI0MDkwNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D) are located at the University's main entrance on Hawk Drive. 

**Paid Parking:** $3 all day parking is available in the [RT. 32 lot](https://www.google.com/maps/place/41%C2%B044'21.8%22N+74%C2%B004'49.9%22...
admission_text:
Bloomberg Connects

#### 

# Introducing a New Way to Explore  
The Dorsky Museum

The [Bloomberg Connects](https://www.bloombergconnects.org/?_branch_match_id=1139224057056879052&utm_medium=marketing&_branch_referrer=H4sIAAAAAAAAA8soKSkottLXTywo0EvKyc%2FPTUotSk%2FOz8tLTS4p1ssvStc3N3DyNM90zs8sTwIAboq2WC0AAAA%3D) app helps The Dorsky to grow connections with our visitors and our wider community. It provides art lovers and curious visitors with an exciting opportunity to delve deeper into our collection and listen to SUNY New Paltz Students as well as Artists speaking about their artworks on display. One feature of the app that is particularly meaningful is the ability to translate interpretive text into any language, allowing the Museum to expand its impact with multilingual audiences.

Use the Bloomberg Connects digital guide to explore our expanded permanent collection display,  _[A Living Collection](/museum/exhibitions/a-living-collection/#d.en.156852),_ which tells the story of The Dorsky from a variety of perspectives and presents the collection as a living entity, continuously evolving and shaped by the viewer's interpretation.

**Using the guide is free and easy:**

  1. [Download](https://www.bloombergconnects.org/?_branch_match_id=1139224057056879052&utm_medium=marketing&_branch_referrer=H4sIAAAAAAAAA8soKSkottLXTywo0EvKyc%2FPTUotSk%2FOz8tLTS4p1ssvStc3N3DyNM90zs8sTwIAboq2WC0AAAA%3D) the free Bloomberg Connects app on your phone.
  2. Search for, or scroll to, The Dors...

# Next at The Dorsky: 

**Check back for future events, or[join our newsletter](https://www.newpaltz.edu/museum/newsletter-sign-up/) for the latest updates.**  

MUSEUM HOURS:

### Wednesday – Sunday  
11 am – 5 pm

**Closed December 15, 2025 – February 7, 2026**

DIGITAL DORSKY:

### Explore _Your Museum_ wherever you are and access exclusive content via the [Bloomberg Connects App](/museum/visit/bloomberg-connects/).

Spring 2026 Opening Party

# Spring Season Opening Party

**February 7, 2026**

**4–6 pm**

Join us in celebrating our newest exhibitions with community artmaking, music, and refreshments.

[ READ MORE  ](/museum/exhibitions/spring-2026-opening-party/)

# Space to Create

**Ongoing**

Creating art is different for each of us. It can be a powerful outlet for self-expression, a form of connection with others, a way to reflect on important issues, or a welcome relief from daily stresses. We invite you to follow art-making prompts related to objects in The Dorsky collection or follow your own creative path by experimenting with the provided materials. Share your creation on the display board, take it home with you to treasure, or gift it to a loved one.

This is your space to create.  
This is your time to be creative.

[ READ MORE  ](/museum/exhibitions/r/)
